titleStmt.title: Marsellus Dougherty et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10090

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Franklin Co.. Feb.. 9th 1861.
To his excelency Beriah Magoffin, Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Marselus Dougherty would respectfully State to his excelency that he was fined at the october term, ten dollars, for a breach of the peace, at the franklin circuit court, your Petitioner would further State at the time he committed the breach, that he was slitely intoxicated and did commit the breach of peace as charged, through a mistake. your Petitioner is a very Small man, and has but little of the goods of this world. And therefore would ask your excelency to remit Such portion of the fine as you may think propper

Marsellus Dougherty
John Bolger Jr
David Henderson
Thos Dougherty
Francis McQuillen
Jno Sullenger Jr
John O Connell
Cornelius Callaghan
W. H. Greenup
L. Tobin
Darniel M Grath
H. R. Powell
Dennis Griffin
P. Jellis
William Bryan
T. Callagahan
B. F. Johnson
S. W. Winter

Franklin Cir. Ct
Petition of Marsellus Dougherty
Remitted
B. M
$10 } Misdemeanor
Issd Feby 9. 1861
